form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Received; read twice and referred to the Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship

form.official-title: To amend the Small Business Act to include requirements relating to new small business entrants in the scorecard program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Small Business Procurement and Utilization Reform Act of 2025 or the SPUR Act.
Section 15(y) of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 644(y)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating subparagraph (E) as subparagraph (F); and
by inserting after subparagraph (D) the following new subparagraph:

The number of new small business entrants, including new small business entrants that are small business concerns owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans, qualified HUBZone small business concerns, small business concerns owned and controlled by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals, and small business concerns owned and controlled by women awarded prime contracts in each North American Industry Classification System code during the fiscal year, and a comparison to the number awarded prime contracts during the prior fiscal year, if available.

paragraph.text: in paragraph (3), by striking subparagraphs (B) through (E) of paragraph (2) and inserting subparagraphs (B) through (F) of paragraph (2); and
by amending paragraph (6) to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: The term new small business entrant means a small business concern that—

clause.text: has been awarded a prime contract by a Federal agency; and
has not previously been awarded a prime contract by any Federal agency.

subparagraph.text: The term scorecard means any summary using a rating system to evaluate the efforts of a Federal agency to meet goals established under subsection (g)(1)(B) that—

clause.text: includes the measures described in paragraph (2); and
assigns a score to each Federal agency evaluated.

section.text: No additional amounts are authorized to be appropriated to carry out this Act or the amendments made by this Act.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives February 24, 2025.
